channel.title: Python for Everybody (Audio/PY4E)
channel.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
channel.itunes:subtitle: These are the audio lectures to supplement the textbook 'Python for Everybody: Exploring Information' and its associated web site www.py4e.com. There is also a video podcast of this material.
channel.itunes:summary: These are the audio lectures to supplement the textbook 'Python for Everybody: Exploring Information' and its associated web site www.py4e.com. There is also a video podcast of this material.
channel.description: These are the audio lectures to supplement the textbook 'Python for Everybody: Exploring Information' and its associated web site www.py4e.com. There is also a video podcast of this material.

item.title: 1.1 Why Program
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: Explore the nature of programming and how programming a computer is different than using a computer.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: Explore the nature of programming and how programming a computer is different than using a computer.

item.title: 1.2 Hardware Architecture
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this lecture we learn abut how the computer processes and stores programs. We learn about the CPU, Memory, Storage and Input / Output devices are brought together to write a program.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this lecture we learn abut how the computer processes and stores programs. We learn about the CPU, Memory, Storage and Input / Output devices are brought together to write a program.

item.title: 1.3 Python as a Language
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how writing programs is just another form of communication. Instead of communicating with another person, we are communicating our ideas to a computer.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how writing programs is just another form of communication. Instead of communicating with another person, we are communicating our ideas to a computer.

item.title: 1.4 What do we Say to Python?
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at the basics of the Python language and how we write code in Python to communicate sequential steps, conditional steps and repeated steps.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at the basics of the Python language and how we write code in Python to communicate sequential steps, conditional steps and repeated steps.

item.title: 2.1 Building Blocks of Python
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at Python's reserved words, how we name and use variables, why we choose meaningful (mnemonic) variable names and how assignment statements function.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at Python's reserved words, how we name and use variables, why we choose meaningful (mnemonic) variable names and how assignment statements function.

item.title: 2.2 Expressions
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we use various numerical and string operations to compute new information and store the new values in variables.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we use various numerical and string operations to compute new information and store the new values in variables.

item.title: 3.1 If-Then-Else
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: The most basic conditional structure is the if statement where we either execute or skip a segment of code based on the results of a logical expression (i.e. asking a question).
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: The most basic conditional structure is the if statement where we either execute or skip a segment of code based on the results of a logical expression (i.e. asking a question).

item.title: 3.2 More Conditional Statements
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this lecture we look at multi-branch if statements and the try-except concept where we can indicate a group of statements to be executed if something goes wrong with a block of statements.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this lecture we look at multi-branch if statements and the try-except concept where we can indicate a group of statements to be executed if something goes wrong with a block of statements.

item.title: 4.1 Using Pre-Defined Functions
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how code flows into and out of functions as well has how we pass information into functions and get results returned to us.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how code flows into and out of functions as well has how we pass information into functions and get results returned to us.

item.title: 4.2 Building our Own Functions
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how to build our own functions using parameters and arguments as well as how we return results to the code that is calling our functions.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how to build our own functions using parameters and arguments as well as how we return results to the code that is calling our functions.

item.title: 5.1 The Basics of Loops
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we construct a loop so that it runs as long as we want it to run. We learn about iteration variables and exiting loops with the 'break' and 'continue' statements.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we construct a loop so that it runs as long as we want it to run. We learn about iteration variables and exiting loops with the 'break' and 'continue' statements.

item.title: 5.2 Definite Loops
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn how to use the 'for' statement in Python to loop through a set of data.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn how to use the 'for' statement in Python to loop through a set of data.

item.title: 5.3 Patterns for Making Loops
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: Loops have a beginning, middle, and end. We look ant how we construct a loop to look at a list of items one at a time so we can compute an overall maximum, minimum or average.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: Loops have a beginning, middle, and end. We look ant how we construct a loop to look at a list of items one at a time so we can compute an overall maximum, minimum or average.

item.title: 5.4 Loop Techniques
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We continue to look at how to construct loops including how to do something special the first time through the loop. We introduce the idea of 'None' which is a way to indicate that a variable is currently empty.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We continue to look at how to construct loops including how to do something special the first time through the loop. We introduce the idea of 'None' which is a way to indicate that a variable is currently empty.

item.title: 6.1 Storing Text Data in Strings
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn how to create string variables and extract portions of the data as well as write simple loops to read through the characters in a string.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn how to create string variables and extract portions of the data as well as write simple loops to read through the characters in a string.

item.title: 6.2 String Operations
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn how to extract substrings using slicing, and use the string library to perform common data extraction operations with strings.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn how to extract substrings using slicing, and use the string library to perform common data extraction operations with strings.

item.title: 7.1 Reading Files
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how text and lines are represented in files, how we open a file and write a loop to read through all the lines in the file.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how text and lines are represented in files, how we open a file and write a loop to read through all the lines in the file.

item.title: 7.2 Processing Data in Files
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at patterns for reading and processing the data in files. We learn how to check for nonexistent files, and how we process each line within the file.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at patterns for reading and processing the data in files. We learn how to check for nonexistent files, and how we process each line within the file.

item.title: 8.1 Creating and Using Lists
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn how to put data into lists, take data out of the list and write simple loops to examine the elements of a list.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn how to put data into lists, take data out of the list and write simple loops to examine the elements of a list.

item.title: 8.2 Manipulating Lists
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn about list slicing, list searching, and using pre-defined functions with lists.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn about list slicing, list searching, and using pre-defined functions with lists.

item.title: 8.3 Strings and Lists
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn how to parse strings pull sub-strings out of a string using the split() function.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn how to parse strings pull sub-strings out of a string using the split() function.

item.title: 9.1 Python Dictionaries
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We compare and contrast how Python lists and dictionaries are structured internally. How we use position to index lists and use keys to index dictionaries.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We compare and contrast how Python lists and dictionaries are structured internally. How we use position to index lists and use keys to index dictionaries.

item.title: 9.2 Building Histograms
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we can use dictionaries to count the frequencies of many things at the same time. We learn how the key and value are related in a dictionary and example the get method to retrieve values from a Python dictionary.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we can use dictionaries to count the frequencies of many things at the same time. We learn how the key and value are related in a dictionary and example the get method to retrieve values from a Python dictionary.

item.title: 9.3 Counting Words in Text
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this segment we bring everything together, reading a file, parsing the lines, and computing the frequencies of the words in the file. This is an important moment that pulls from everything we have learned so far.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this segment we bring everything together, reading a file, parsing the lines, and computing the frequencies of the words in the file. This is an important moment that pulls from everything we have learned so far.

item.title: 10.1 Understanding Tuples
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at the basic syntax and capabilities of Python tuples. We explore the concept of immutability, and we compare tuples to lists and strings.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at the basic syntax and capabilities of Python tuples. We explore the concept of immutability, and we compare tuples to lists and strings.

item.title: 10.2 Sorting Data
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we sort lists, dictionaries, and lists of tuples in Python.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we sort lists, dictionaries, and lists of tuples in Python.

item.title: Worked Example: Sorting Dictionaries
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: Worked Example: Sorting Dictionaries
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: Worked Example: Sorting Dictionaries

item.title: 11.1 Introduction to Regular Expressions
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at the syntax of regular expressions and how to use them to search through text data.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at the syntax of regular expressions and how to use them to search through text data.

item.title: 11.2 Matching and Extracting Data
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this segment we learn to pull out data from strings after a regular expression has found a match.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this segment we learn to pull out data from strings after a regular expression has found a match.

item.title: 11.3 String Parsing with Regular Expressions
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how some of the string parsing we have done in earlier chapters can be easily done with regular expressions.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how some of the string parsing we have done in earlier chapters can be easily done with regular expressions.

item.title: 12.1 Network Technology (TCP/IP)
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We take a very brief look at how software communicates across the Internet using TCP/IP.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We take a very brief look at how software communicates across the Internet using TCP/IP.

item.title: 12.2 Hypertext Transport Protocol (HTTP)
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this section we look at the HTTP protocol that is used to move documents between web servers and web browsers.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this section we look at the HTTP protocol that is used to move documents between web servers and web browsers.

item.title: 12.3 Building a Web Browser in Python
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We write a simple Python program that connects to a web server and retrieves a web document. It is a very simple web browser.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We write a simple Python program that connects to a web server and retrieves a web document. It is a very simple web browser.

item.title: 12.4 Unicode Characters and Strings
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We explore how characters are encoded when they are transported across the network.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We explore how characters are encoded when they are transported across the network.

item.title: 12.5 Retrieving Web Pages
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We write an even simpler Python program to retrieve a web page using the urllib library in Python.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We write an even simpler Python program to retrieve a web page using the urllib library in Python.

item.title: 12.6 Parsing Web Pages
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: Now we will look at the HypertextMarkup Language (HTML) that we retrieved using Python and extract links from that HTML. We are slowly building a very simple web search engine.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: Now we will look at the HypertextMarkup Language (HTML) that we retrieved using Python and extract links form that HTML. We are slowly building a very simple web search engine.

item.title: 13.1 Data on the Web
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at two different ways to format data for transmission across the network including JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and eXtended Markup Language (XML).
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at two different ways to format data for transmission across the network including JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and eXtended Markup Language (XML).

item.title: 13.2 eXtensible Markup Language (XML)
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how data is represented using the XML format.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how data is represented using the XML format.

item.title: 13.3 XML Schema
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we can use XML Schema to determine whether or not a particular bit of XML is valid.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we can use XML Schema to determine whether or not a particular bit of XML is valid.

item.title: 13.4 JavaScript Object Notation
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn about the popular JSON data format and how to handle the JSON data in Python.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn about the popular JSON data format and how to handle the JSON data in Python.

item.title: 13.5 Service Oriented Approach (SOA)
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We talk briefly about how applications can be built over time to depend on services provide other applications.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We talk briefly about how applications can be built over time to depend on services provide other applications.

item.title: 13.6 Using Application Programming Interfaces
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We explore using a Google API that can be used to query location data and parse the JSON that is returned.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We explore using a Google API that can be used to query location data and parse the JSON that is returned.

item.title: 13.7 Securing API Requests
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We explore the use of OAuth to communicate sign requests to establish identity when using the Twitter API.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We explore the use of OAuth to communicate sign requests to establish identity when using the Twitter API.

item.title: 14.1 Object Oriented Definitions and Terminology
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how Python mentions objects in its documentation as well as talk about why philosophy of object-oriented programming. We explore some OOP terms like class, object, instance, method, and attribute.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how Python mentions objects in its documentation as well as talk about why philosophy of object-oriented programming. We explore some OOP terms like class, object, instance, method, and attribute.

item.title: 14.2 Our First Class and Object
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how use create a new class in Python and then construct a new object from that class. We also look at some of the Python objects (like strings) that we have been using all along.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how use create a new class in Python and then construct a new object from that class. We also look at some of the Python objects (like strings) that we have been using all along.

item.title: 14.3 Object Life Cycle
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we as the developers of a Python class can interact with the moment of construction and destruction of various objects created using the class.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we as the developers of a Python class can interact with the moment of construction and destruction of various objects created using the class.

item.title: 14.4 Object Inheritance
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we can make a new class by inheriting all of the attributes and methods of a parent class and then extend the new class with additional attributes and methods.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we can make a new class by inheriting all of the attributes and methods of a parent class and then extend the new class with additional attributes and methods.

item.title: 15.1 Relational Databases
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at the history of database systems, learn the terminology of database systems, and review some of the common database systems that are in use.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at the history of database systems, learn the terminology of database systems, and review some of the common database systems that are in use.

item.title: 15.2 Single Table SQL
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We learn about how we can use Structured Query Language (SQL) to insert (create), read, update, and delete data in a single database table.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We learn about how we can use Structured Query Language (SQL) to insert (create), read, update, and delete data in a single database table.

item.title: 15.3 Building a Relational Model
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we can take the various data elements that will be modeled in an application and distribute them across several tables efficiently. We learn about the basic rules of database design.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we can take the various data elements that will be modeled in an application and distribute them across several tables efficiently. We learn about the basic rules of database design.

item.title: 15.4 Database Key Types
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at primary keys, logical keys and foreign keys. We look at how foreign keys are represented in the database.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at primary keys, logical keys and foreign keys. We look at how foreign keys are represented in the database.

item.title: 15.5 Representing Relationships in Database Tables
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how we map a logical database model to a physical database model by adding columns and constraints to model the table-to-table relationships.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how we map a logical database model to a physical database model by adding columns and constraints to model the table-to-table relationships.

item.title: 15.6 Multi-Table Retrieval using JOIN
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how to reconstruct complete views of the data when data is properly distributed across multiple tables and connected via foreign keys. We learn the JOIN operation and ON clause in SQL.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how to reconstruct complete views of the data when data is properly distributed across multiple tables and connected via foreign keys. We learn the JOIN operation and ON clause in SQL.

item.title: 15.7 Many-to-Many Relationships
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We look at how to build a connector table to represent many-to-many relationships such as students and courses in database tables. We also learn about composite primary keys.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We look at how to build a connector table to represent many-to-many relationships such as students and courses in database tables. We also learn about composite primary keys.

item.title: 16.1 Visualizing Map Data
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: In this assignment we make use of the Google GeoCoding API to look up addresses, store the data in a database and then use Google Maps to visualize the data.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: In this assignment we make use of the Google GeoCoding API to look up addresses, store the data in a database and then use Google Maps to visualize the data.

item.title: 16.2 Building a Web Search Engine
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We build a web crawler that retrieves web pages and links from those pages an copies the pages into the database. Once we have retrieved our web data we run a simple Page Rank algorithm on the data and visualize the results.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We build a web crawler that retrieves web pages and links from those pages an copies the pages into the database. Once we have retrieved our web data we run a simple Page Rank algorithm on the data and visualize the results.

item.title: 16.3 Processing Mail Data
item.dc:creator: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.description: We end where we started, processing email data. Except that this time it is a lot (nearly 1GB) of email data.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Russell Severance
item.itunes:summary: We end where we started, processing email data. Except that this time it is a lot (nearly 1GB) of email data.
